channel.title: Best Apache, PHP, MySQL server for Windows?
channel.description:
Alright. Before you get me wrong, of course I'm going to do my real hosting on a Linux-based machine, but my development environment it currently on Windows.
I'm looking for a lightweight, Windows-based web server that supports PHP, MySQL and Apache that I can run as a local test environment before deploying my stuff to the web.
I've heard of xampp, is it any good, or are there better ones?

item.title: Best Apache, PHP, MySQL server for Windows?
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Thanks guys.

Read full topic

VB7 Rocks:

I’ve heard of xampp, is it any good, or are there better ones?

It is the best, download it and love it.

item.source: Best Apache, PHP, MySQL server for Windows?

item.title: Best Apache, PHP, MySQL server for Windows?
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

I heard those are just installers for Apache PHP MySQL so in the end the answer is the same lol some come with process monitor to see if any of the apps like mysql or apache is working

there is tons of em
XAMPP - http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=61776
EasyPHP - http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=14045
phpdev - http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=39203

Uniform Server - http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=53691 <- this one says is highly lightweight but by the date seems old.

Server2Go - http://www.server2go-web.de/index.html <- has 5 packages to pick from ranging from 72 MB and as low as 5 MB one package doesn’t even use mySQL uses SQLLite and its very small in size… check it out maybe

says

yar xampp seems to be the most updated used

Read full topic
